Monolithic architectures don’t scale well. To take advantage of an Infinitely Scalable Serverless technology, we need to start thinking about our systems as a set of modules. One module for user management, another module for order processing, and so on, and so forth. All modules (aka microservices) are talking to each other forming a robust scalable system where each module can be scaled individually as opposed to scaling the entire monolith. ![Illustrating the difference between monolith and microservices](https://images.rightbalance.io/uploads/monolith-microservices-2.svg)

Event-Driven Programming

Software systems are built to automate complex processes. Each process consists of some operations. If all operations are a sequential set of steps built in a monolithic way, it’s hard to scale it, hard to maintain it and develop it because all steps are tightly coupled. To take full advantage of Serverless, we’ll need to break down the complex processes into individual steps triggered by events. An example is triggering a Lambda function when a file gets uploaded to an S3 bucket. Once the file arrives, the Lambda gets triggered to process a file and write it to a data warehouse. Doing so allows us to use AWS Lambda being able to process as many files as we want to lean on the cloud provider to do the scaling work for us. ![Event driven programming illustration](https://images.rightbalance.io/uploads/event-driven-programming-2.svg)

Automatic Deployments (CI/CD)

By automating away the process of deploying our code to the cloud, we enable our developers to focus on what matters most: writing code for new features. To do so, we build an automated deployment pipeline which consists of the following major steps: ![A typical CI/CD pipeline](https://images.rightbalance.io/uploads/cicd-pipeline.svg) You can read more about CI/CD pipelines in our [CI/CD solution](/solutions/ci-cd-like-ac-dc-rock-n-roll-with-continuous-integration-and-continuous-delivery).

Efficient Monitoring and Alerting

Each cloud provider has a specific set of metrics associated with each Serverless resource. In the case of AWS Lambda, it reports the number of invocations, logs for each lambda, number of failures, and more metrics into [CloudWatch](https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/). We can set the alerts on our CloudWatch metrics to report to Slack, Email, and Text when some unusual activity happens. To make our monitoring efficient, our alerts will be precise and specific. So when they arrive, it’s clear what happened and what to do next. Each alert has a severity level. If something is slightly off, it can go to Slack or email. And for some critical component outages, it can go to text or perhaps even a call for an on-call person using a [PagerDuty](https://www.pagerduty.com/) alert.

Automated Testing

Manual testing is great with one drawback: you need to do it again and again every time you push new code. Which leads to a costly big bang releases that are no fun. You don’t want to waste your precious engineering time on manual testing. Instead, writing a comprehensive set of unit tests, functional tests, and integration tests will go a long way. You can add them to your [CI build pipeline](/solutions/ci-cd-like-ac-dc-rock-n-roll-with-continuous-integration-and-continuous-delivery) to run every time you deploy your code automatically.

Execution

[Right Balance](http://rightbalance.io/) is your development partner helping you seamlessly integrate Serverless into your technology stack. The Right Balance team helped many successful businesses to use Serverless to achieve their business goals. Most of the companies are running on the latest and greatest technology stack, producing a lot of features with increased velocity. Companies running on the latest technology stack is a fun and exciting place to work in. This helps with attracting some quality candidates in the current competitive job market. When it comes to integrating new technology, it can be integrated in the following ways:

Gradual Integration

When the current system needs to stay in place and it still functions well, a gradual introduction of new technology makes the most sense. The advantage of such an approach is that it’s flexible. It allows for the existing feature development to continue on the current platform while introducing new technology at the same time without any disruption. In this case, we’ll start with integrating Serverless into one part of the overall system. Writing a new microservice from scratch and connecting it with the rest of the system using some API calls allows putting the architectural patterns in place laying out the groundwork for new development. Once the initial architecture is in place, we can expand further with either migrating the current platform over to the new stack step by step or continue on the new stack for the new feature development.

System Rewrite

In the case where the entire system doesn’t perform to its expectations when the current feature development is extremely slow and the existing staff doesn’t want to deal with the system anymore, it’s easier and more effective to rewrite the entire system all at once. Here, we’ll build an entirely new system on the latest technology stack while having the old system running. Then we’ll start migrating the user data over to the new system. Once the migration is complete, we’ll switch over to the new system and turn off the old one. The users will see a new system as just a regular upgrade next time they log in. This is also a great opportunity to delight a user with some new features only available on a new system. In addition to it, it’s a great time to update the look and feel of the product on the front end.

_data.title: DevOps Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in being our TechOps engineer?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details
Our client is a leading software solutions provider in the online advertising market. The platform streamlines the ad sales processes for some of the most prominent publishers on the Web.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.
You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of professional full-time hands-on DevOps experience.
2. 3+ years of Azure experience.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. 2+ years of IaC experience.
3. 1+ years of Terraform experience.
4. Experience building monitoring solutions with Grafana or similar.
5. Azure pipelines experience.
6. MSBuild familiarity.
7. Azure functions familiarity.
8. Kubernetes experience.
9. Docker experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size
The Right Balance team has 40+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 25 engineers, expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year.
It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

1\. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.

2\. 2+ years of IaC experience.

3\. 1+ years of Terraform experience.

4\. Experience building monitoring solutions with Grafana or similar.

5\. Azure pipelines experience.

6\. MSBuild familiarity.

7\. Azure functions familiarity.

8\. Kubernetes experience.

9\. Docker experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size_?

The Right Balance team has 40+ engineers going to 100+ by the end of the year. The current client team size is 25 engineers, expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year.

It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in this opportunity?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong Full Stack Software engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client’s mission is to connect online and offline identities in a way that promotes understanding, fairness, and accountability; aiming to use this connected identity to better inform the most important decisions we make as humans. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capitalists and institutional investors, they are an AI-based software solution that identifies problematic behavior among potential hires and current employees by analyzing publicly available online information. Enterprise Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Leaders from numerous large companies trust them to identify abusive behaviors, such as bigotry and harassment, that are often missed in the hiring and management process.

By using Data Science and Machine Learning, they are helping hundreds of brands across the globe to screen thousands of people every month, while rapidly growing their traffic 30% month over month by utilizing the SaaS model.

Our Python-based Serverless Microservices with FastAPI on the backend power our modern web frontend applications written in React / Redux. Lots of greenfield development for new Microservices as well as Microfrontends. We’re using the latest AWS services like Aurora, Lambda, EventBridge, believing in automated testing and solid DevOps principles. Plenty of scaling challenges as well as exposure to Machine Learning and Data Science. Join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of hands-on full-time coding experience.
2+ years of modern Javascript frontend using React / Redux or similar.
5+ years of backend experience using FastAPI / Flask / Django or similar or Node.js / Express or similar.
Experience in both Javascript and Python.
1+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS (or GCP or Azure) cloud services, preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies.
1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile product development.
Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
Excited to learn new languages and technologies, and eager to build software using them, learning from your colleagues.
Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO.
Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
Believe that in the world of Product Engineering, DevOps is king, meaning engineers own the product, from design to implementation, QA to production support.
Unit test experience.
Nice to haves
Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Golang, Javascript,
React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS
Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Team leadership experience.
Team management experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double in the next 12 months. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

12. Believe that in the world of Product Engineering, DevOps is king, meaning engineers own the product, from design to implementation, QA to production support.
13. Unit test experience.

## Nice to haves

1. Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Golang, Javascript,

   React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS
2. Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
3. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
4. Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
5. Team leadership experience.
6. Team management experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double in the next 12 months. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

We're looking for a strong Go engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is changing the way consumers purchase and get support for new technology. Is the leading independent, nationwide on-demand technology support platform that provides affordable, same-day on-site and 24/7 online tech support services. Utilizes a network of thousands of independent technicians throughout the US that are hand-selected, vetted, and background-checked to provide a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and product sales.

You’ll help to build scalable, robust, rock-solid solutions that provide a smooth customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of large-scale, multi-tier distributed software applications and tools.

Innovate with us and showcase your work to millions of users across the United States. The technology stack includes Kubernetes microservice environment, each service with a separate PostgreSQL datastore. We use Kafka to communicate between our microservices written in Ruby on Rails and Go. Our system serves 10 million events per month.

This is your opportunity to do exciting production-grade work in Go. We’re implementing performant dispatch algorithms routing thousands of orders per day. New services and ETL pipelines are developed using the proper design patterns and focusing on efficiency. Join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1+ years of full-time hands-on work experience in Go.
5+ years of full-time hands-on work experience as a Back End Developer.
Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.
Proactive communication skills that establish trust.
Passion for building top-notch software applications and tools.
Customer experience mindset.
Experience with unit testing and backend integration testing.
Experience working with other engineers within a team and across teams proactively.
Ability to take product requirements and develop software architectures and designs.
Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve the software as well as build new product features.
Experience managing individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.
Basic ability to troubleshoot applications running in Linux-based environments and in containers.
Nice to haves
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field.
Experience with Kubernetes.
Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
Experience in Software Development in one or more general-purpose programming languages including but not limited to C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, Go, Rust, Objective-C, and/or Swift.
Big O notation.
Experience with CI/CD (we use CircleCI).
laC experience (we use Pulumi).
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?
The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double it this year. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.

You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

5\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

6\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 2+ years of professional full-time QA experience.

2\. 1+ years of professional SQL experience.

3\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

4\. Basic understanding of SDLC.

5\. Basic understanding of QA strategy.

6\. Basic understanding of quality test cycle.

7\. Experience creating and documenting test cases.

8\. Strong analytical abilities.

9\. Familiarity with automated testing and how it works together with the QA strategy.

10\. Solid troubleshooting skills..

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.

2\. Zephyr experience.

3\. CI/CD system experience (we use Azure Pipelines).

4\. Cloud experience (preferably Azure).

5\. API Testing experience with Postman(SOAP and Rest).

6\. Selenium or equivalent experience.

7\. Software development experience.

## Frequently Asked Questions

>_What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

>_What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

>_What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

>_What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

>_What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

By using behavioral research, data science, and adaptive multi-channel platform, they deliver personalization at scale for the most trusted healthcare organizations in all 50 states in the USA, including seven of the 10 largest health plans.

We’re using event-driven architecture on the backend with microservices serving millions of people every year and sending tens of thousands of messages every hour. Join us, it won’t be boring!

Professional hands-on experience with Ruby and Cucumber or RSpec.
Experience developing and writing queries for RDBMS and NoSQL databases.
Experience with source control GitHub or similar.
Experience working with Agile methodologies and cross-functional teams.
Hands-on experience with JSON data structures.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, being able to communicate across all levels of the organization.
Passionate about well-crafted, high-quality code that is built to scale.

We're looking for a strong senior-level Front End Developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is a global leader for app-driven in-store & campus technology that delivers digital media to screens and tablets for corporate TV, digital marketing boards, digital signage, and interactive kiosks using an intuitive content management console in the cloud. They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

We are using the latest technologies like Serverless with AWS Lambda and NoSQL (MongoDB). Our serverless microservices written in Node.js transfer close to 5TB of data per month among all devices at scale. It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!

## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Front End Developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is a global leader for app-driven in-store & campus technology that delivers digital media to screens and tablets for corporate TV, digital marketing boards, digital signage, and interactive kiosks using an intuitive content management console in the cloud. They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

We are using the latest technologies like Serverless with AWS Lambda and NoSQL (MongoDB). Our serverless microservices written in Node.js transfer close to 5TB of data per month among all devices at scale. It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of professional full-time hands-on front-end coding experience (any of Angular, React, Vue, jQuery, Bootsrap, etc).
 2. 3+ years of experience with Angular.
 3. 2+ years of experience with CSS.
 4. Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
 5. Experience working with RESTful Web Services.
 6. Expertise in Document Object Model and DOM Functions.
 7. Extensive knowledge in developing applications in a single page (SPAs).
 8. Experience writing unit tests and testing tools like Jasmine or Protractor.
 9. Competence in version control and deployment systems like Git, Bitbucket, and Bitbucket pipeline.
10. Experience with Agile/Scrum methodology working in a team environment, actively participating in retrospectives to improve practices.
11. Experience working with back-end developers and UI/UX experts to ensure that the definition of done is fully satisfied.
12. Drive performance tuning, contribute on unit and integration testing.
13. Ability to embrace and institute best practices and coding standards within the team
14. Experience composing detailed design specifications.
15. Ability to contribute on 3D concepts, implementation and technologies along with fast prototyping.

## Nice to haves

1. Ability to remain aware of evolving needs and opportunities, showing flexibility in doing whatever is appropriate to support the Company’s success.
2. Desire to pursue educational opportunities to maintain advanced and up-to-date knowledge in the field.
3. Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all-inclusive.
4. Ability to contribute on the WCAG 2.0 AA level.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview

We're looking for a strong Ruby on Rails engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is changing the way consumers purchase and get support for new technology. Is the leading independent, nationwide on-demand technology support platform that provides affordable, same-day on-site and 24/7 online tech support services. Utilizes a network of thousands of independent technicians throughout the US that are hand-selected, vetted, and background-checked to provide a top-notch customer experience for a wide range of services, including computer support, smart home device installation, home office setup, and product sales.

You’ll help to build scalable, robust, rock-solid solutions that provide a smooth customer experience. You’ll be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of large-scale, multi-tier distributed software applications and tools.

Innovate with us and showcase your work to millions of users across the United States. The technology stack includes **Kubernetes** microservice environment, each service with a separate **PostgreSQL** datastore. We use **Kafka** to communicate between our **microservices** written in **Ruby on Rails** and **Go**. Our system serves **10 million events per month**. Join us, it’ll be fun!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1. 2+ years of full-time hands-on work experience in **Rails**.
2. 4+ years of full-time hands-on work experience as a Back End Developer.
3. Passion for building top-notch software applications and tools.
4. Customer experience mindset.
5. Proactive communication skills.
6. Experience working with other engineers within a team and across teams.
7. Ability to take product requirements and develop software architectures and designs.
8. Ability to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software as well as build new product features.
9. Experience managing individual project priorities, deadlines, and deliverables.

## Nice to haves

1. Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field.
2. Interest and ability to learn other coding languages as needed.
3. Experience in Software Development in one or more general-purpose programming languages including but not limited to: C/C++, Java, Python, JavaScript, Go, Rust, Objective-C and/or Swift.
4. Experience with automated testing.
5. Big O notation.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double it this year. The current client size team is 80+ engineers and more than 325 employees in total.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a Fullstack Engineer to join our team. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details
Our client is a leading software solutions provider in the online advertising market. The platform streamlines the ad sales processes for some of the most prominent publishers on the Web.

We’re committed to continuous innovation by using the latest technologies in the cloud arena. We’re moving to microservices, optimizing the flow of data in the AdTech stack to connect publishers and advertisers in a meaningful way.

You'll be working with a large scale system involving a lot of features, working with terabytes of data in our database. Performance is important for our team, as well as scalability. Constantly challenging the status quo, we're always improving our processes. Your voice will be heard.
You'll make an impact on the team by utilizing your technological experience.

Our stack is .NET on the backend, moving to .NET Core with SQL Server deployed to Azure Cloud. On the frontend, we’re using Vue.js. Our release pipeline is streamlined with CI/CD running on Azure pipelines. For our infrastructure, we believe in managing it as code, currently using Terraform to do so. Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!
What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
5. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
1. 5+ years of professional full-time coding experience.
2. 3+ years of experience with .NET (or Java / Spring).
3. 1+ year of frontend experience with Vue.js (preferred), or similar like React, or Angular.
4. 2+ years of SQL experience.
5. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
6. Solid understanding of Object Oriented Programming.
7. Deep knowledge of design patterns.
8. Azure cloud familiarity.
9. Generics experience.
10. Stored procedure familiarity and having an opinion on it.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Team management experience.
3. Tech leadership experience.
4. Professional Azure experience.
5. Experience with XML.
6. Telerik experience.
7. Web services experience, specifically WCF.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client team size is 30 engineers expanding to 50 engineers by the end of this year . It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow.
We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details
Our client is a post Series D company at a $900M valuation that has raised more than $400M in funding across equity and debt.

in annual transactions. Its mission is to connect people with their passions by simplifying the transaction process

like **React**, **Django**, PostgreSQL, and Docker running on AWS cloud. We believe in **automation** and strong architecture.
With us, you’ll be building robust **microservices** on the backend, single source of truth **data lake**, as well as modern
componentized front end experience. Join us, it won’t be boring. We’re building new products on a path towards **$1.5B
in loan originations this year**.

## What’s in it for you
1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3. 3+ years of full-time hands-on experience on the backend.

7. Experience working in a collaborative team environment.

10. Experience and desire for mentoring junior engineers.

4. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.
5. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
6. Growth stage startup experience.
7. Technical leadership experience.
8. Team management experience.
9. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage.
Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly.
That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year.
The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees,
looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year.
It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down,
we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous,
working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning
as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level full stack web developer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client is the customer intelligence partner that empowers businesses to maximize customer-level profitability. The team (former Facebook, PayPal, and Stanford alums) has built a product that can predict individual customer lifetime value at the earliest point of customer contact and change how brands view their relationships with their customer. Using data science to predict future buying behavior of consumers and recommend actions that businesses can take around those predictions. As a full stack web developer, you’ll be responsible for developing robust, scalable full-stack deployment of Serverless web applications using Vue.js, AWS Lambda, Node.js, and FastAPI. Also, want to get your hands dirty with writing some data massaging code using R or Python? We have it as well. In addition to it, you’ll be a part of a team led by an AI technology leader and seasoned hands-on multi-startup CTO with over 15 years of experience.

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies for a venture-backed startup.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 5+ years of professional full-time hands-on coding experience.
 2. 3+ years of web front end development with Vue, React or latest Angular.
 3. 3+ years of web backend API development with any of Express / Koa or similar, FastAPI / Django / Flask or similar, Ruby on Rails, PHP (Laravel or Symphony, Yii, not Wordpress).
 4. Advance knowledge of the latest Javascript and/or Typescript language.
 5. The proven history of being productive with multiple languages the right idiomatic way.
 6. Working knowledge of UI/UX best practices and clear understanding of what makes good UX.
 7. Advanced verbal level of English.
 8. Experience working with AWS or GCP or Azure.
 9. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to  achieve them in a team setting.
10. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer, Data Scientists, and Data Engineers in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
11. Strong knowledge of scalable front end and backend API architecture, best practices, and tools.
12. Use best practices for writing secure and reliable web applications.
13. Passion for innovation and execution. Commitment to quality engineering.
14. Expert level problem solver.
15. Ability to think and act strategically and proactively.

## Nice to haves

 1. 1+ year of hands-on Python.
 2. Develop interactive data science visualizations (includes the opportunity to learn the power of R Shiny).
 3. Experience with API integration.
 4. Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related technical field from a top-tier university (or equivalent industry experience at a major technology company).
 5. Expertise in ensuring cross-browser and cross-device compatibility.
 6. Experience in an Agile work environment with automated tests, and CI/CD.
 7. AWS Lambda experience.
 8. Serverless framework experience.
 9. Automated testing.
10. Runtime complexity analysis using Big O notation.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in this opportunity?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Full Stack Software Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client is a global leader for app-driven in-store & campus technology that delivers digital media to screens and tablets for corporate TV, digital marketing boards, digital signage, and interactive kiosks using an intuitive content management console in the cloud. They enable retailers to maximize their floor space by using the power of the "endless aisle" where consumers are offered a broader assortment of products even in the smallest physical store environment. They improve the commerce experience by connecting brands, retailers, and consumers through beautiful smart software.

The retail landscape is undergoing major changes. Help us to build beautiful and elegant interactive experiences for brands and retailers to navigate these shifts in consumer behavior to weather the commerce evolution.

We are using the latest technologies like Serverless with AWS Lambda and NoSQL (MongoDB). Our serverless microservices written in Node.js transfer close to 5TB of data per month among all devices at scale. It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our client's face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
5+ years of full-time hands-on experience in JavaScript.
3+ years of Node.js experience.
3+ years of NoSQL (MongoDB, DynamoDB, or similar) experience.
2+ years of full-time hands-on experience with AWS Lambda.
Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
Experience with data modeling and patterns using NoSQL database technology.
Experience developing Cloud applications with API management and distributed microservices-based architecture.
Ability to challenge and improve the underlying technology stack.
Must be comfortable around both front & back end technologies, development frameworks, 3rd party libraries, QA, and everything else that's required for the team to succeed.
Experience with or capability and desire to operate in Agile/Scrum methodology.
Ability to contribute to research technologies and fast prototyping
Ability to compose detailed design specifications.
Willingness to actively participate in root cause analysis and design sessions.
Nice to haves
Willingness to perform all other related duties as required, assigned and understanding that the items in this description are not all inclusive.
Experience in or burning desire to try TypeScript.
Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring and testability.
AWS or similar cloud certification..
Experience with Web application development using Angular.
Good knowledge of Docker and deployment life cycle.
Ability to create and drive better metrics, monitoring initiatives to gain valuable insights from the cloud services.
Ability to troubleshoot all build and deployment issues.
Ability to work remotely across time zones .
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers expanding to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 10 engineers with a total of 35 employees. It’s your opportunity to make meaningful contributions in a tight team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

It’s a full-stack Javascript/Typescript opportunity since the front end is written in Angular. If you love technical challenges, and the fun of building great things, join us!

3. Ability to drive performance tuning, automation, monitoring and testability.
4. AWS or similar cloud certification..
5. Experience with Web application development using Angular.
6. Good knowledge of Docker and deployment life cycle.
7. Ability to create and drive better metrics, monitoring initiatives to gain valuable insights from the cloud services.
8. Ability to troubleshoot all build and deployment issues.
9. Ability to work remotely across time zones .

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers expanding to 100 by the end of the year. The current client size team is 10 engineers with a total of 35 employees. It’s your opportunity to make meaningful contributions in a tight team of highly skilled professionals.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.text:
## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level Python engineer. Headquartered in

Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1\. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

2\. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.

3\. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.

4\. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings.

Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.

5\. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.

6\. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.

7\. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

1\. 5+ years of full time hands-on backend experience.

2\. 4+ years of full time hands-on experience with Python, Django (of Flask or FastAPI).

3\. Ability to write clean, modular, scalable, well-tested code, setting an example for others.

4\. Ability to lead by example, understand client’s goals, create and implement solutions to achieve them in a team setting.

5\. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, QA Engineer in a highly collaborative and proactive way.

6\. Strong knowledge of scalable backend API architecture, best practices, and tools.

7\. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.

8\. Experience with automated testing.

9\. Clear understanding of the runtime complexity of the code being written.

10\. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.

## Nice to haves

1\. A formal Computer Science degree.

2\. Working experience in a proper Agile / Scrum team environment.

3\. Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.

4\. Deep understanding of runtime complexity and memory complexity using Big O notation.

5\. Growth stage startup experience.

6\. Technical leadership experience.

7\. Team management experience.

8\. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> _What are your typical clients?_

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> _What is the length of your projects?_

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> _What’s your company size?_

The Right Balance team is 10 - 15 engineers. The current client size team is 20 people looking to double it this year. It’s exciting to be a part of this growth making some meaningful contributions.

> _What happens if the engagement is completed?_

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> _What are your core values?_

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

## Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level QA Engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.

## Project Details

Our client just raised a $50M series B round of funding and is looking to double the engineering team in the next 6 months. It’s your chance to join a high-quality engineering team with the hands-on CTO from SpaceX, MySpace, and Honest Company.

Text messaging adoption is growing rapidly. Now, an average person spends 23 hours a week texting. The product is a text messaging automation software platform allowing E-Commerce store owners to do most of their customer communication over text messaging as opposed to old-school calls and emails.

The technology stack is React.js on the front end with Redux Saga, Storybooks, slick-looking UI with a custom design system, and an AI-powered conversation builder using the Canvas API.

The front end is powered by Python / Django backend API on top of a PostgreSQL database with Kafka processing high throughput text messages at the scale of 10s of millions of messages per day. Soon we’ll be adding NoSQL and Kubernetes into the mix. Join us, it’ll be a lot of fun!

## What’s in it for you

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
2. Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
3. We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
4. Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
5. Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
6. Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
7. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

## Required Qualifications

 1. 4+ years full-time hands-on Quality Assurance experience.
 2. 2+ years full-time hands-on experience in a Technical Analyst role.
 3. 2+ years of experience using SQL with extensive experience in analytical techniques.
 4. 1+ years full-time hands-on experience with Cypress.
 5. 1+ years of Cloud Assurance experience.
 6. Intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
 7. Deep understanding of SDLC and experience applying that to execute test strategies.
 8. Proven track record of mitigating risks.
 9. Proven track record of test techniques.
10. Proven track record of implementing successful test strategies including test plans and tools.
11. Experience working with remote development teams.
12. Experience with strategic goal setting and execution.
13. Experience working directly with a Product Manager, Designer, Engineer, etc in a highly collaborative and proactive way.
14. Strong desire to take ownership and responsibility.
15. Ability to think outside of the box and work on the same project long term with a high degree of care.

## Nice to haves

 1. B.S. in Computer Science or math.
 2. Ability to read/write code in Python and JavaScript.
 3. Understand testing concepts in applying test automation (risk assessment, priorities assessment, etc).
 4. Familiarity with cloud monitoring tools such as DataDog, CloudWatch, etc.
 5. Experience working with AWS.
 6. ISTQB Foundation Level.
 7. Growth stage startup experience.
 8. Technical leadership experience.
 9. Team management experience.
10. Open source contributions, presentations, and publications.

## Frequently Asked Questions

> What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

> What is the length of your projects?

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

> What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions  in a team of highly skilled professionals.

> What happens if the engagement is completed?

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

> What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

Some of our services use Azure functions, as well as running in containers on Kubernetes. Having a lot of fun doing it, join us!

1. Work with the latest and greatest technologies.

6. Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.

1. 4+ years of professional full-time experience doing manual QA.
2. 2+ years of SQL experience.
3. Upper-intermediate to fluent speaking and writing English.
4. Full understanding of SDLC.
5. Full understanding of QA strategy.
6. Full understanding of the quality test cycle.
7. Experience creating and documenting test cases.
8. Strong analytical abilities.
9. Knowledge and understanding of automated testing and how it works together with the QA strategy.
10. Basic understanding of the software architecture.
11. Solid troubleshooting skills.
Nice to haves
1. A formal Computer Science or equivalent degree.
2. Zephyr experience.
3. CI/CD system experience (we use Azure Pipelines)
4. Cloud experience (preferably Azure)
5. API Testing experience with Postman (SOAP and Rest)
6. Selenium or equivalent experience
7. Software development familiarity.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.

Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.

Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.

_data.title: Senior TechOps Engineer
_data.cta_header: Interested in being our TechOps engineer?

children.value: Overview

We're looking for a strong senior-level TechOps engineer. Headquartered in Los Angeles, California, Right Balance applies the latest technology and the best engineering practices to help businesses grow. We’re in the top 50 companies to watch in LA.
Project Details

Our client’s mission is to connect online and offline identities in a way that promotes understanding, fairness, and accountability; aiming to use this connected identity to better inform the most important decisions we make as humans. Backed by some of the world’s leading venture capitalists and institutional investors, they are an AI-based software solution that identifies problematic behavior among potential hires and current employees by analyzing publicly available online information. Enterprise Human Resources and Talent Acquisition Leaders from numerous large companies trust them to identify abusive behaviors, such as bigotry and harassment, that are often missed in the hiring and management process.

By using Data Science and Machine Learning, they are helping hundreds of brands across the globe to screen thousands of people every month, while rapidly growing their traffic 30% month over month by utilizing the SaaS model.

Our Python-based Serverless Microservices with FastAPI on the backend power our modern web frontend applications written in React / Redux. Lots of greenfield development for new Microservices as well as Microfrontends. We’re using the latest AWS services like Aurora, Lambda, EventBridge, believing in automated testing and solid DevOps principles. Plenty of scaling challenges as well as exposure to Machine Learning and Data Science. Join us, it’ll be fun!
What’s in it for you
Work with the latest and greatest technologies.
Learn from the best people. We constantly challenge the status quo, learn from each other, and invent new ways of building a great product.
We actually write automated tests. We take advantage of the latest automation tools like automatic deployments, CI/CD pipelines, and more.
Flexible hours. Just join daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings. Other than that you’re in control of your own schedule.
Work remotely at the comfort of your home or a shared co-working space.
Work on challenging problems, innovate, have fun while doing it.
Travel around the world. We offer occasional business trips to work with our clients face to face from their offices.
Required Qualifications
2+ years of hands on full time Infrastructure as code experience
5+ years of hands-on experience in at least one of the primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
5+ years of hands-on experience in the other primary areas of TechOps focus: DevOps, DataOps, SecOps, or ProdOps
3+ years of experience building and managing software products on AWS cloud services preferably focused on AWS serverless technologies
1+ years working within teams that believe in and live the principles of lean-agile, DevOps-guided product development
Upper-intermediate to Advanced level of verbal English.

Regardless of area of expertise, have the desire and ability to participate in ProdOps within a high-volume SaaS company, including being on call to coordinate response to, and participate in the solution of, production issues.
Strong ability to communicate clearly and authoritatively with both technical and non-technical teams.
Ability to help determine when to build something ourselves, and when to buy technology to fit our use cases.
Comfortable working with diverse people and teams across the organization, from operations analysts to the CEO and being able to communicate across the organization on all aspects of TechOps.
Ability to iteratively design and build solutions aligned to the roadmap.
Serve as a subject matter expert in your primary area(s) of expertise.
Lead and participate in production support and incident response.
Believe in the client’s mission, work every day to live that mission, and help others do the same.
Natural desire and ability to mentor and teach those you work with.
Belief that in the world of TechOps, documentation is not waste.
Nice to haves
Professional experience with many of these technologies: Java, Python, Golang, Javascript, React, Spring, Django, Cassandra, Kafka, MongoDB, Postgres, or other RDBMS.
Knowledge of Runtime and memory complexity using Big O notation.
Deep understanding of automated testing, ability to set up automated testing frameworks, testing architecture, data seeding, mocking, and implementing best testing practices.
Open-source contributions, presentations, and publications.
Assist in selecting vendors to provide solutions when we choose not to build them ourselves.
Team leadership experience.
Team management experience.
Frequently Asked Questions
What are your typical clients?

The majority of our clients are venture-backed startups at the growth stage. Usually, at this stage, the company already achieved a product-market fit and is looking to expand rapidly. That’s where we bring the best engineering practices, strong architecture, and the latest technologies to help companies scale.
What is the length of your projects?
Most of our long-term full-time engagements last multiple years.
What’s your company size?

The Right Balance team is 30+ engineers looking to double by the end of the year. The current client size team is over 40 engineers with close to 200 total employees, looking to keep growing fast and aiming to hire up to 150 new employees over the next year. It’s your opportunity to be a part of this growth making meaningful contributions in a team of highly skilled professionals.
What happens if the engagement is completed?
Most of our engagements are long-term in nature. That said, if the current project is ramping down, we’ll present you with more long-term opportunities to transition into.
What are your core values?

We value autonomy, grind, empathy, mastery, and giving back to the community. We expect you to be autonomous, working directly with the client to build the best product. We value hard work, helping each other, constant learning as well as open-source contributions, and knowledge sharing.
